comments.commentBody: Your article touched me. I am the woman who married the man like your husband. He had been married for nearly 34 years. I had been for 31. We both lost our spouses. I never thought I would marry again. But the first time I saw him, I knew. I want you to know that you will always be important to your husband. I know that much of his first wife, Joyce, makes up much of who he is now, and I know she was a beautiful woman. I know he loved her deeply. I know she loved him. I know she was a good mom because I know her girls. I know she was a great friend, because I know her friends. I feel like I knew her. I would want her to know how much her husband loved her and that she is the reason why he was willing to marry again. The legacy she left has left an indelible mark upon her husband and her world. I stumbled on your article this morning while surfing the internet, so this is the first I time I heard about you. I will look for more of your writings now. I will pray for you.

Your post is as wonderful as Ms Rosenthal 's essay, filled with real love. Bless you Donna and your husband. And as I said before too, miracles do happen. May Ms Rosenthal beats this illness and live a long life with her loving family.

It's sweet (and salty/bitter/sad) to find myself in the arms of a man who lost the love of his life way to soon. I am grateful to my darling's darling wife - she was a generous soul, like you, Amy.  Jason may or may not find another great love, but it's possible.  If he does, she will nurture YOUR loving spirit and be grateful to YOU.  Their fairy tale beginning will include you.

The only downside of real love, not the Hollywood type, is the dilemma of who goes first. The dead achieves peace, while the survivor endures the grief which time is unlikely to heal. The Taj Mahal, the greatest monument to love had its birth in such circumstances.

Yes, how many of us must forego love for fear of its loss? The grief of the one going, saying farewell to every precious scintilla of love, is far greater. Though that by no means undermines the heartbreak of those who are left behind. The sweet and dear price of love.

Bless you Amy.  Why in God's good name, aside from the present and very unfortunate circumstances, would your husband ever be with anyone other than you?  I'm afraid no one would ever be as selfless, eloquent, selfless as you.  As tempting as Jason sounds, by all accounts you are his light, his life, his love, and I pray a miracle intervenes, your health returned, your prayers answered.  God willing, I will be in Chicago in October, you will be well, and if anything I would meet you, a woman with incredible strength, love beyond measure, who gracefully exemplifies acceptance under very dire circumstances.  God willing, your husband, entrusted to all those you both love, will have the love and healing needed to care for your beloved children, under any circumstance and get through this difficult time.  You leave me almost speechless...except for sentiments expressed here.  I'm not a doctor, but I believe in miracles, so fight…stay strong. You astound me, in the best way, and are a woman after my own heart.  Hang in there Amy :) <3 the world needs more courageous, loving women like you!!  I don't know you but I love you already...

If you think you are reassuring her with your exhortations of miracles, reassess, please. Perhaps her miracle is the love she gave and received. Who are we to judge what is "enough" for any other person?
Very moving.

I lost my little boy to cancer at age 4. He was my first true love. My first everything. The reason I breathed. But before he died, I was given a little girl. She was a preemie and had problems of her own. She saved my life. I now have 3 of them! I am saying this because I hope that your love finds a "girl" to save him when his love is gone. I pray for your courage and strength to be with you always.
Love, Meagan

G-d bless you and your family Amy. I googled you and found your website.I hope someone will link "The Beckoning of Lovely Story." You have clearly created joy and beauty and shared love. That must transcend our physical time here.

Dear Amy,
Thankyou for sharing your story. I hope you 'go gently' and send you and your family all of my love. I'm sorry this is happening to you.

What a wonderful thing to do for your husband.  As I sit here early in the morning reading the paper and worrying about my poor wife of 28 years, still upstairs trying to get a few bits of sleep interspersed between the pain of the progressive cancer, I can only hope that she has as sweet an opinion of me as you have of Jason.  I love Plan "Be" and thank you for coining it.  I hope your last days are as peaceful as possible and that your children have future mates and marriages as blessed as yours.
Thank YOU for wishing her peace and not a medical miracle. The greatest gift.
I read Little Pea to a 3 year old recently. She loved it. Thank you.

Speaking of Trump's contempt for the State Department, the Constitution and the American people etc, one thing we need to bear in mind is that Trump is a narcissist who holds no-one else in high esteem except for himself. He never fails to show utter disdain and disgust towards anyone or anything considered to be worthless, inferior, undeserving of respect.
The actor Tom Arnold claimed last December to have video of Trump using racist language, obscenities and denigrating his own son in outtakes of The Apprentice. Trump is recorded to have said "the N-word, saying the C-word, calling his son a retard, just being so mean to his own children."
Occasionaly we do hear Trum heaping praise on other people. It's because he wants something from them or he wants to show some generosity and noble-spiritedness.

He should have released it! It may have made just the difference in countering James Comey.

He should release it now. Any defense funds could be crowd-sourced, although I'm sure he has more than enough of his own money to pay for and mount a skilled defense.

Thank you for your wonderful courage and humor. I'm in the middle of breast cancer, and this made my day.
http://www.thecriticalmom.blogspot.com
Hope you beat the disease. Good Luck and all the very Best. God Bless you.
I can quite well imagine, with credentials like this, Jason is well and truly off the market. It reads as though two soul mates found each other and, if he found the 'one', there won't be a 'two'.
He will love again because he was loved.

I just want to say:

your writing is great and....

Please accept my most heartfelt best wishes in your new future.
Just beautiful.  Thank you for yanking my heart and deepening the kiss I gave my love this morning.  You are touching, and will always Be.

I am struck by the generosity of your spirit.  It rings true to me-when one faces that dark night everything petty drops.  And if you have love and gratitude you will wish the best for the ones you love and the rest of us still here on this part of our journey.  Not everyone faces death this way.  Not everyone faces life.  Blessings to you and to your loving husband.  I am sure you have bestowed riches on one another.

In cinematic reference and hoping this does not sound crass, the story and these "Reader's Choice" comments remind me of the "you need something to love" letter and puppy delivered to John Wick after the funeral by his recently deceased wife.
Richard I rarely agree with you but I respect your position on this issue.  We need both parties to come together and come up with a compromise that both Republicans and Democrats can live with.

"Rent a mob" seriously? Unless you've got proof, please stop spreading the ridiculous propaganda that anti-Trump protesters are getting paid. Stop pretending that the policies being enacted aren't seen as profoundly disturbing to a large portion of American citizens. You can like those policies all you want, but you don't get to make a fiction out of those who see things differently.
Walking tall on the backs of actual, real people. Otherwise, sniveling runt.
I just finished dinner, and unthinkingly clicked on this.  Big mistake.  I feel some projectile vomiting coming on.
Yes, GOP, stand strong - it will make it so easy to unseat so many of you next year.   Please - be recalcitrant, turn deaf ears to your constituents.

I don't agree with most of what Governor Walker has to say.

However, I would like to know whatever happened to the

10th Amendment.
In addition, Gov. Dayton was willing to spend whatever it took to cover the shortfall of ACA insurers pulling out of the market, instead of forcing people off the roles.

Rent-a-mobs? You wish.

Those people you think are being paid by the ever-popular International Jew happen to be your sisters, your friends, your neighbors and maybe, if you have one, your wife.

They are the voters. Yes.

Sorry if that upsets you.

But yes, we the people are trying to talk to our so-called representatives, who actually represent only a) people who think exactly like them b) corporations, especially fossil fuels and c) the extremely wealthy assuming they're right wingers (Soros begone!)

This is a democracy (so far) and our so-called public servants work for US.

The great warrior for the people, Scott Walker, reveals his battle wounds! People dressed as zombies showed up at his ceremony! General Scott Walker, leading the charge against the unions! Yes, Walker, voters are angry because your party only has plans to repeal, eliminate, rescind or destroy anything that has even the lightest touch of Barack Obama. Your party has forgotten how to build anything, even the simplest of structures, except when it benefits the rich. But, you, in your bubble, would not understand that. So once more into the breach, sir! Stand strong and keep fighting your battles. But, remember, your name will live only in infamy.

I'm sorry Governor, but if Wisconsin is such a great example for the rest of the country then why does your approval rating routinely hover around 40%? Do the majority of Wisconsinites not recognize the fantastic work you've done on their behalf? If that's the case then perhaps you should focus your outreach towards your constituents, rather than telling the rest of the country how to do it.
